newsitem.title: SINGAPORE: Singapore untraded, anxiety mounts over Goodyear.
newsitem.headline: Singapore untraded, anxiety mounts over Goodyear.

text.p: Trading in the Singapore rubber market remained listless by the midday break on Friday while anxiety mounted because of the unresolved strike at Goodyear Tire, dealers said.
"There were no requests for offers this morning. The strike in Goodyear is not over. That's making some people nervous out here," a trader said.
Another dealer said the possible sale next week by the U.S. Defense Logistics Agency (DLA) has forced some players in the market to retreat to the sidelines.
"There's very little business being done at the moment," a dealer said. "People are waiting for the DLA because we understand it should take place next week."
One trader said the market was still being hounded by weak consumer demand.

At around 0445 GMT, June RSS3 was indicated at 106.25 U.S. cents a kg from 106.75 cents. June RSS1 was indicated at 154.00-156.00 Singapore cents (US$1.07-$1.08) a kg from 154.25 cents. June TSR20 was indicated at 147.00-149.00 Singapore cents (US$1.02-1.03) a kg from 148.75 cents.
